headline: Polen Global Growth Portfolio Q2 2025 Commentary
summary: During the quarter, Polen Global Growth Portfolio returned 8.16% gross of fees (7.87% net of fees) compared to 11.53% for the Index. Read more here.

headline: American Airlines Group (AAL) Expands Mastercard Partnership for Enhanced Travel Rewards
summary: American Airlines Group (AAL) recently announced a renewed partnership with Mastercard, focused on enhancing the AAdvantage program through advanced technology and personalized offers, which aligns well with its recent 34% share price rise over the last quarter. Concurrently, the market has been buoyant, achieving new highs in the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, supported by strong earnings across sectors. This optimism contrasts American Airlines’ recent financial performance with Q1 losses, but the...

headline: Why banks hold the key to the Genius Act’s breakthrough for stablecoins
summary: Banks are well poised to intergrate stablecoins. Regulatory regime unfolds for crypto. Challenges mount for payments adoption.

headline: American Airlines and Mastercard Renew Partnership for Even More Rewarding Travel Experiences
summary: FORT WORTH, Texas & PURCHASE, N.Y., July 21, 2025--American Airlines and Mastercard today announced an extension of their decades-long partnership, reinforcing a shared commitment to delivering more rewarding travel experiences and value through advanced payments technology and services.

headline: Mastercard reports declining emissions and rising revenue for second straight year
summary: The global payments company also surpassed and remains “on track” to hit interim 2025 emissions reductions targets.

headline: What are stablecoins and why are Visa and Mastercard so concerned? | Retire on Track
summary: Stablecoins, a type of cryptocurrency, can potentially cut out traditional money processors like Visa and Mastercard entirely.

headline: Ethiopia to Launch Its First Domestic Credit Card--Powered by OpenWay and SanuPay
summary: In a landmark development for East Africa's financial sector, SanuPay, a next-generation third-party payment processor licensed and headquartered in the UAE, has partnered with OpenWay, a global leader in digital payments software, to launch Ethiopia's first domestic credit card. This rollout marks a pivotal shift in the country's move toward a formalized and digitally enabled financial infrastructure.
